txt: Are you looking at naked tribe's women?
No, look. (Shows him the magazine.)
That's a pig.
I know, I know, but look at the knobs on her.
Hey! (Joey quickly hides the magazine under the couch.)
Emily's cousin kicked me out!
What?!
Why?

Well, when you're subletting an apartment from your wife's cousin and then
you get a divorce, sometimes the cousin suddenly wants his apartment back.
How can he do that? Didn't you sign a lease?
Who needs a lease when
Hey, you can stay with us! We'll take care of ya!

Oh, yeah! Absolutely! Anything you need man! But you have to promise
me the second you are feeling better so that we can make fun of your hair!
Yeah.
You got it.
Okay.

Thanks you guys, I really appreciate this. All right, I'm gonna get
packing again. Man, I've been moving around so much I'm beginning to feel like a nomad.
What?
He thought you said gonad.

Wow, Monica, if every restaurant is as clean as yours, I'd have a
tough time making a living.
Oh, Larry.
Umm, do health inspectors work on commission?
No, bribes.
It's okay to laugh right?
Yeah, I was just kidding.
Okay. (She laughs harder.)
I'll check the kitchen floors.
Okay, knock yourself out, Larry.
Yum-my!
Larry?
Oh yeah! I'd let him check out my kitchen floors.

(entering) A 98. I deducted 2 points because you are not wearing your
chef's hat, and

Uh, look, Larry honey, umm, I wrote the book on Section 5 and I know
that you don't have to wear your hat unless you're in the kitchen.
And where is your hat?
It's in the kitchen, I'll go get it.
Ahh
Hey, you should really read that book you wrote. (To Larry) Wow! You
Oh, I don't know about that.
Yeah, but then I can be you sidekick Vunda.

Maybe uh, Vunda could give me her number and I can ask her to dinner
sometime.

Okay, she would love that! Y'know, 'cause you know all the clean places
to eat.
I-I'll call ya.
Okay.
He's so funny! (She imitates what he just did.)
Thanks.
Thank you. (To Monica) Mon?
Hmm?
How's Ross doing? Y'know since all the Emily stuff.

He's not great umm, but he's dealing with it. Oh wait a minute, you're
not gonna try…

Oh, honey, please, no, I can't get started with all that Ross stuff
again. I mean, he's gonna screwed up for a looong time. And besides y'know, I don't, I
don't go for guys right after they get divorced.
Right, you only go for them 5 minutes before they get married.
(To Gunther) Two pounds of Moca Java please.
(To Monica) Danny. Are you guys ever gonna go out again?

I don't know! He hasn't called me since that one time when we went out.
I see him in the hallway, we flirt, I'm all ha-ha-ha-ha, and nothing.
(To them) Hey!
Hi Danny! (Notices his box of liquor he's carrying.) Wow! Thirsty huh?

Uh, actually, actually, I'm having a party at my place on Saturday, it's
sort of a house warming kind of thing.
Ohh, fun!
Ohh, great!
Yeah, I'm really looking forward to it.
Yeah.
Okay, see ya. (Heads out.)
Well, I guess we won't be warming his house.

(laughs) Okay. All right, I see what he's doing! He's not asking me out,
because he wants
And you're not gonna do that.
That's right! 'Cause
So-so there is no party.

No, there's a party. There's a party. But the power, that is still up
for grabs. You follow me?

I think so. Se, he-he's not inviting you to his party because he likes
you.
Exactly.
Ross?
(entering from the bathroom) Hey roomies!
Love what you've done with the place.

Oh, yeah I know, I know, it's a lot of boxes, but again I really
appreciate you guys letting me stay here.

Not a problem. And listen, hey! Since you're gonna be here for a while,
why don't—I was thinking we uh, put your name on the answering machine.
Oh yeah!

Oh, I uh, hope you don't mind, I kinda uh, jazzed it up a little. Check
this out. (He plays the greeting, and
Hey, all right!
Pretty cool, huh?
(To Chandler) You're fake laughing too, right?
Oh, the tears are real.
You look beautiful this evening.
(smiles) Show me the badge again.
Shiny.

Oh, will you mind if I wash up? Because I came straight from work and who
knows where these babies (Holds up his hands) have been.
(laughing) You are just nonstop!
(coming back) We're outta here!
Why?!

Just walking past the kitchen I saw 10 violations! I'm shutting this
place down!
(awed) You have the power to do that?
This does. (Shows her his badge.)
(excited) Shut it down.
Hey.
What are you doing?
Nothing.
You built a fort didn't ya?
(smiles) Kinda.

(notices something) Oh my God, the air purifier! Ross's air purifier!
All I heard through 4 years of college was (makes a humming noise.)
Dude, you should've gone out once and a while.
I

Come on, Chandler, Ross is our friend. He needs us right now, so why don't
you be a grown up and come and watch some TV in the fort!
Oh, hi Danny.
Hey guys, I just uh, wanted to invite you to the party tomorrow night.
Oh, thanks! We'll try to stop by.
Uh, actually, I think I'm gonna be busy.
You are?
Yeah! Remember I got that uh, gala.
Yeah, what's the gala for?
It's a uh, regatta gala.
Really! You-you sail?
No-no, but I support it.
Okay, (To Monica) hope I see you tomorrow night.
Okay.
Take care. (Leaves.)
Okay. (Closes the door.) Walked right into that one didn't he?
What one? You wanted him to invite you to the party and he did it!

Yeah, but he waited until the last minute! So if I said yes, he would
know I had nothing better to do than wait around for an invitation to his stupid party. I
said, "No!" Which puts
Great. So the ball is in his court?
Ball? There is no ball.
(glaring at him) Joey, please! (Motions to his computer.)
Sorry.
Ahhhhhhhhhh…
(entering) Hello children!
Hey! Wanna play some foosball? Please?
Okay. (Starts to head for where the foosball table usually is.)

No-no, no! We have to move the table into my room, yeah! 'Cause of all the
boxes. Come on!
All right, I have one question.
Bye-bye little puppet Joey hand?
No, the quiet down thing!
You mean this. (Does the maneuver perfectly.)

Um-hmm! Look, I-I-I don't know how much more of this I can take! Did you
know he taped over my

(gasps) All right look, y'know, this maybe tough but come on, this is
Ross! I survived college with him!
All right, I guess I can hold out a little longer. Let's have a game.
Okay.
No-no-no-no!
YES!!

(entering) Uh fellas, (Does the maneuver and gives them a double thumbs
up, which Chandler returns as he closes the door.)
Okay, so he's out of here.
Um-hmm.
(entering) Hey!
Hey!

You guys got anything to eat? I just went down to Johnos for some chicken
and it was closed!

Oh, I took Larry there to eat but it was all violated. So we shut it
down!

Pheebs, if this guy keeps closing down all of our favorite places, where
are we gonna eat?!
I don't know, clean places?
Umm, yum!
(looking through the peephole) It's Danny.
Don't let him in! I'm supposed to be at a regatta gala.

(to Danny) We'll be right there! (To Rachel) Can't you just say it
starts later?
What? What kind of a regatta gala starts at night?!
The fake kind!
Hey, hi, I need a ladle. You got a ladle?
We have a ladle. (Gives him one.)
Thanks, see you at the party.
Okay, great!

Hey, guys, you know what Larry would say? He would say, "See you
ladle." (Laughs.)

Well, I-I-I'm done with this. You want anything Ross? Sports?
International? Apartment listings?
I'll take sports.
Mine! (He grabs it.)
All right. Uhh, international.
Oh that's mine too! (Grabs it and Ross looks at him.) I'm Italian!

Well, I guess I can check out those apartment listings, even though
there's never anything in here.
Not even on page 7?

(looks) Oh yeah! You're—hey, you're right! Here's an affordable
place, (reading ad) two bedroom, close to work, ooh, it's available in five weeks!
What about that circled one?
Oh, I-I don't know, it's kind of expensive for a studio.
But it's available now! Isn't it?
Yes, it is.
Hey, let's go look at it! (They both jump up.)
Okay, let's go.
Okay!
There we go!

Oh-oh-ooh, hey guys, I was wondering if you guys would uh, maybe chip in
on some new air filters for the air purifier? I mean after all, we all are using it.
Let's go quicker.
Yeah!
Oh my God! (Looking around, which doesn't take him long.)

Yeah, well look at this kitchen, slash bathroom. Well that's great!
Y'know so you can cook while in the tub.
Somebody was using his head. Hey, let's check out the rest of the place.
I think this is it. I don't know, maybe we should keep looking.
But hey, Ross, this place is available now!
Yeah, you don't want to be stuck with us for the next five weeks.
Yeah.
(To Joey) So, you-you think I should go ahead and take this place?
Oh, it's perfect!
(To Chandler) How about you?
It's a kitchen slash bathroom.

All right, I see what you guys are saying. I'll uh, I'll go downstairs and
fill out an application.
We are bad people.

He knew we were trying to get rid of him. He knew! (Pause.) You think we
could get a bathtub in our kitchen?
(entering) Hey, ready for dinner?
Ooh, absolutely!

Great! How about you wanted to go the Italian place down on Bleaker
Street right?
Ooh, I love that place! (Thinks about it.) So, no.
How about Mama Lisettie's?
Enh. Sure!

(notices something) I wonder how long that milk (on the counter) has been
setting out.

Oh, no-no, this place is totally healthy! That—this milk is mine. I
bought this today, 'cause I was thirsty for milk, y'know. (She takes a swig of it, but has
to turn away from him as she makes a face to show that it has gone bad.) Okay, let's go!

Hey, buddy! (Flashes his badge.) Are you familiar with Section 11-B of
the Health Code that requires all refuse material out the
But then I'd have to go all the way around the dry cleaner place.
Oh, so you're saying you'd choose convenience over health?!

Okay, stop! Larry, okay, can't you just be Larry and not Larry the
health inspector guy? Y'know I mean it was really exciting at first but now it's like,
okay, so where are we gonna eat ever?
Well, I suppose I could give him a warning.

Thank you. (To Gunther, who's standing there frozen) Okay, go! Go! Go!
(He runs off.) (To Larry) Now, if after dinner you still really need to bust someone, I
know a hot dog vendor who picks his nose.
Maybe, maybe we did a good thing, helping Ross get back on his feet!
Yes that was a nice place!
Yeah!

Not a lot of closet space, but he can just hang his stuff out the
window in a bag!
Yeah!
What are we gonna do?
I don't know. Maybe pizza?
About Ross!
Oh! Oh!

Hello! (Listens.) Oh yeah! (To Chandler) It's the apartment manager; Ross
put us down as references. (To the apartment manager.) Ross is the greatest guy you'll
ever meet! Yeah, he's very reliable.

(grabbing the phone) Of course he has this big huge dog! That uh,
barks into the night. (Listens.) Well, who doesn't love dogs? (Thinks.) Ah, he's a tap
dancer! (Listens.) Yes, some would say that
Ohhhhh!
Shoot, shoot, this is never gonna work! He's right there!
Just go over and say hi.

No, I have to go downstairs and come back up as if I'm coming home from
the regatta gala. Okay? So just go distract him. But don't be sexy.
Hey, Danny!
Hey! What's going on?

(turns his back to the stairs) Oh, it's a great party! Great food.
Y'know, most parties it's all chips and salsa, chips and salsa. (As she's saying this
Rachel tries to head downstairs but is blocked by people coming upstairs. She quickly
retreats back up the stairs.) (Sees that she has to keep him distracted longer.) So umm,
what's this? (Points to his plate.)
Salad.

Ooooh! (Rachel now succeeds in getting downstairs.) And-and-and
what-what's this? (Points again.)
Bread. Aren't you a chef?
(upon seeing Rachel she points) Oh.
Hey! Rachel!
Hey! Oh right, tonight was your party.
Oh wow, you look great! Glad you could make it.
Oh well, y'know, the gala had to end sometime.
Don't go anywhere, I'll be right back. (He heads off.)
Yeah, sure. (To Monica) All right, whose court is the ball in now?
I thought there wasn't a ball?

Oh, come on! He's glad that I came, he doesn't want me to go anywhere,
balls flying all over the place!
(returning, with a friend) Rachel, this is my friend Tom. (To Tom)
Oh, go on! You telling people about me?
You two could really hit it off! I'm gonna go mingle. (Leaves.)
So you work at
(laughs) Yeah, okay, at ease solider!
I'm sorry?

No, it's all right, you can just drop the act Tommy. I know what's going
on here. Your Danny's wingman right? You guys are best buds. Frat bros!
I'm gonna go talk to uh, a friend.

Yeah, yeah, you go talk to your friend. You tell him, "Nice
try."

Man! He just keeps lobbing them up and I just keep knocking them right
out of the park!
I think I need a drink.
Yeah!

(getting up) Dude, I'm telling ya! I'm fine! (He tries to take a step and
falls flat on his face.)
Here we go! Here we go!
Hey!
Hey!

Hey. So I uh, I didn't get that apartment. Some problem with my
application.
You're kidding!
You're kidding, no!

Yeah. But, the good news is that Phoebe said that I could stay at her
place for a while. So…
But you can't stay with Phoebe, Ross! We're-we're roomies!
Look, you guys don't need me here taking up your space.

Well, we got plenty of space! There-there's still some over there (Points
to where the window is but sees that there isn't any space there and points towards his
door.) by-by that speaker. Please, just stay!
Yeah!
Are you guys sure about this?
Definitely!
Yes! Ross, you have to stay!
All right.
All right!
All right, buddy!

So I'm a pimp huh? It's okay! Look, I know that sometimes I can be a pain
in the ass, but you just have to talk to me. Tell me if something is bothering you. Okay?
And for my part I will do everything I can to keep my annoying habits just (Does the
'quiet down' maneuver).

Well, I see you've had a very productive day. Don't you think the
cowboy hat is a little much?
(popping up behind Joey wearing an Indian headdress) Come on, it's fun!

All right! (He joins them in the fort and comes up putting on a
bonnet.) Isn't this a woman's hat?
Dude, stop talking crazy and make us some tea!
